result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Vernon Carr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent, Anger Management and follow through.
Provide DNA sample.

No violent or abusive contact with victim 1 while parties are incarcerated and if either party is released no contact directly or indirectly.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
No criminal conduct.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.

with Huber for work release

9:01 AM Defendant Richard Vernon Carr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck appeared by video for Richard Vernon Carr.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Limbeck - case is resolved, plea questionnaire e-filed last week.
Atty Limbeck - Deft will plead No Contest to Count 1 as a Repeater and State will move to Dismiss and Read in Count 2 for recommendation of 3 years Probation w/ 6 months conditional Jail imposed & stayed and additional conditions as stated on the record. Joint recommendation.
Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. 
Deft pleads No Contest to Count 1.
Court finds Deft Guilty on Count 1 and Dismisses and Reads in Count 2.
(Court goes off record)
9:35AM - Court recalls.
State makes sentencing argument.
Defense makes sentencing argument.
Deft makes statement to Court.
Court orders 4 years Probation with 90 days conditional Jail to commencing at the end of the Deft's 2nd 9 month jail term, with Huber for work release and other conditions as stated on the record.
98 days credit if revoked.
